goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by population?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of state capitals by population
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of population sizes of state capitals and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the population of a state and the population of its capital?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of state population vs capital population
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between the population of a state and the population of its capital.

goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by longitude and latitude?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of state capitals by longitude and latitude
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the geographic distribution of state capitals and identify any patterns or clusters.

goals.question: What is the most common first letter of state capitals?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of state capitals by first letter
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any patterns or trends in the naming of state capitals.

goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by region?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of state capitals by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the geographic distribution of state capitals and identify any regional patterns or differences.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.barplot(x='state', y='population', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by population?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='state_population', y='capital_population')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the population of a state and the population of its capital?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='longitude', y='latitude')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by longitude and latitude?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    data['first_letter'] = data['capital'].apply(lambda x: x[0].upper())
    letter_counts = data['first_letter'].value_counts().reset_index()
    letter_counts.columns = ['first_letter', 'count']
    chart = sns.barplot(x='first_letter', y='count', data=letter_counts)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        chart.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the most common first letter of state capitals?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    region_counts = data['region'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(region_counts, labels=region_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by region?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
